PyAnnotation Module - PyGraphParser.py¶

class PyGraphParser.EdgeInfo(id='', fromID='', toID='')[source]¶

Used to store information about edges when parsing the GrAF XML representation.

class PyGraphParser.PyGraphParser[source]¶

Used to parse the GrAF XML representation and construct the instance of C{PyGraph} objects.

version: 1.0.

__init__()[source]¶

Create a new C{PyGraphParser} instance.

annotation_set_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse <annotationSet .../> elements in the XML representation.

annotation_space_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse <annotationSpace .../> elements in the XML representation.

as_end()[source]¶

Used to parse end /as> elements in the XML representation.

as_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse start <as/ ...> elements in the XML representation.

characters(ch)[source]¶

Processes any characters within the xml file. It’s a method from ContentHandler class.

depends_on_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse dependsOn elements in the XML representation. Finds other XML annotation files on which depend the current XML file. Parses the dependency files and adds the resulting graph to the current graph.

edge_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse edge elements in the XML representation. Edge information is stored and the edges are added after all nodes/spans have been parsed.

endElement(name)[source]¶

Processes the end xml tags, according to their type. It’s a method from ContentHandler class.

feature_end()[source]¶

Used to parse end features elements in the XML representation.

feature_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse start features elements in the XML representation.

fs_end()[source]¶

Used to parse </fs> elements in the XML representation.

fs_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse <fs> elements in the XML representation.

graph_end()[source]¶

Executes when the parser encounters the end graph tag. Sets the root node and adds all the edges to the graph. Neither of these tasks can be safely performed until all nodes have been added.

graph_start(attrs)[source]¶

Executes when the parser encounters the begin graph tag Initializes the data structures used to construct the graph. The element attributes are added to the new graph as features.

link_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse link elements in the XML representation.

node_end()[source]¶

Adds the current_node to the graph being constructed and sets self._current_node to None.

node_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse the node start tag. Creates a new self._current_node, of type PyNode.

parse(file, parsed=None)[source]¶

Parses the XML file at the given path.

Returns:a PyGraph representing the annotated text in GrAF format
Return type:PyGraph
region_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to pare the region elements in the XML representation. A tolkenizer is used to separate the anchors listed in the XML tag, and a new PyAnchor instance is created for each one. A PyRegion instance is then created with the id from the XML tag and added to the graph.

root_end()[source]¶

Used to parse end root elements in the XML representation.

root_start(attrs)[source]¶

Used to parse start root elements in the XML representation. The root characters are processed by the characters() method and stored in self._buffer.

self._root_element is a flag indicating the presence of a root.

startElement(name, attrs)[source]¶

Processes the opening xml tags, according to their type. It’s a method from ContentHandler class.
